sourceMeaningMnemonic: If you're on a <radical>mountain</radical> looking from <radical>above</radical> to <radical>below</radical> that means you're on the <kanji>peak</kanji> of the mountain.
meaningInfo: Imagine standing right at the peak of a mountain looking at down from above and everything down below. You're really, really high up!
readingMnemonic: It's only on this type of mountain <kanji>peak</kanji> that you'll be able to find the rare and adorable <reading>To</reading>kyo <reading>ge</reading>cko (<ja>とうげ</ja>). These tiny little critters can only be found on the ridges going above and below the mountains in Tokyo. There are like six mountains in Tokyo, so the next time you're scaling the ridges keep your eyes open for the Tokyo gecko!
readingInfo: Picture yourself sitting on a mountain peak in Tokyo and watching a little Tokyo gecko run up and down on them. It's adorable and totally worth the climb.
